intro: Monnina splendens, commonly known as the splendour bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Monnina splendens is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
